CONCERNS: Noise on barges
PDT_DISC_CONC: Acoustic barrier can potentially resonate in the empty barges due to hollow hulls creating nuisance.
PDT_DISC_LIKELI_IMPACT: Could interfere with communications between deckhands and captains; empty barges becoming an amplifier of the sound; may lose efficacy of deterrent system if volume levels must be lowered; impacts to public use of the adjacent area
PDT_DISC_RISK_MANAG_STRATEGY: Continued R&D; collect data; evaluate affects on actual navigation vessels at Lock 19;
ACTION_ITEMS: Finish R&D, Design Charrettes, and preliminary design

CONCERNS: Single source for speakers, sole proprietor
PDT_DISC_CONC: Single source production rate is very limited; sole source procurement required;
PDT_DISC_LIKELI_IMPACT: If we need to change to another source there will be an impact to design when it comes to housing size, channel layout/recesses etc.; pulse acoustic technologies;
PDT_DISC_RISK_MANAG_STRATEGY: conduct a sources sought of other speakers; development salient characteristics specifications;  laboratory testing of other systems; sources sought on salient conditions desired
ACTION_ITEMS: Finish R&D, Design Charrettes, and preliminary design

CONCERNS: Interaction with Bubble Curtain
PDT_DISC_CONC: Don't know the effects air bubbles will have on sound
PDT_DISC_LIKELI_IMPACT: acoustic barrier performance may be diminished by bubble curtain;. Air normally effects sound propagation in water; two technologies combined have not included fish response; operational cost of air compressors at L19 in conjunction with acoustic testing
PDT_DISC_RISK_MANAG_STRATEGY: Testing at Lock 19 with air bubble curtain on can be done to collect data; look at other sites testing bubble curtains (Barkley, Peoria); look at funding OD for additional air compressor costs at testing sites
ACTION_ITEMS: Finish R&D, Design Charrettes, and preliminary design

CONCERNS: Operability, maintainability, sustainability
PDT_DISC_CONC: Acoustic system has not been tested for 25 or 50 yr. operation
PDT_DISC_LIKELI_IMPACT: Unknown until measured; increased maintenance and/or repair/replacement
PDT_DISC_RISK_MANAG_STRATEGY: Test speakers for an extended period of time;  measure the success (durability and any degradation) at Locks 19 & 6;
ACTION_ITEMS: Finish R&D, Design Charrettes, and preliminary design

RISK_OPPORTUNITY_EVENT: If we don't have NRG property for Construction Staging Sites, rock placement
CONCERNS: RDB is designated spot for all rock spoils, would double handle or haul away driving cost, staging area may be impacted based on availability of NRG property
PDT_DISC_CONC: don't have RDB, then additional look at permitting, hydraulics, cost of handling, method for control building would need to be altered if not placed on rock fill, utility access to LDB if have to build there, power to the facility, build cross over?
PDT_DISC_LIKELI_IMPACT: At some point need to begin pursuing LDB option, hydrologic investigations of that LDB site etc. if RDB not available; set a "go, no go" date of January 2022 with the assumption HTRW phase 2 samples will have been obtained and analyzed by that date;
PDT_DISC_RISK_MANAG_STRATEGY: Obtain and analyze phase 2 HTRW samples
ACTION_ITEMS: Complete Design Charrettes, and preliminary design, and sampling for HTRW

RISK_OPPORTUNITY_EVENT: Operation of Flushing Lock in Combination with Hydro Power Study
CONCERNS: Balance of water between hydro power and flushing lock may be difficult.
PDT_DISC_CONC: USACE controls the water supply and would govern availbility to any developed hydropower ventures
PDT_DISC_LIKELI_IMPACT: under USACE control - no impact
PDT_DISC_RISK_MANAG_STRATEGY: Establish water usage agreements

CONCERNS: Design of concepts, channel depths, etc.
PDT_DISC_CONC: water column distribution of current, shallower channel depth, what is the consequence at Brandon Road, leads to material choices and voltages, can we accommodate the same design as at Romeoville?
PDT_DISC_LIKELI_IMPACT: Due to the minimal depth between the electrodes and the barges that design parameters will be changed drastically.
PDT_DISC_RISK_MANAG_STRATEGY: Working at defining design parimeters for varying tailwater conditions to set limits for the design of the electric barrier sampling of water conductivity.

CONCERNS: Coast Guard provides final operating parameters different from our current assumptions and changes the efficacy of the electric barrier after implementation
PDT_DISC_CONC: USCG will provide the final regulated navigation area dictating the operating procedures for the area, build project first then USCG testing
PDT_DISC_LIKELI_IMPACT: Coast Guard personnel rotate out every three years, need to build continuity through the project
PDT_DISC_RISK_MANAG_STRATEGY: Conduct workshops and design charrettes with USCG and navigation, make sure they are included on research presentations; When new staff comes in update them on the project.
ACTION_ITEMS: Keep USCG involved

CONCERNS: Model construction fitting within our timeline
PDT_DISC_CONC: We'll want enough modeling to have a definitive path forward to complete design, we may be changing operational requirements for dam operation if a flushing lock is incorporated.  If we don't have remote operations of the dam now, does this require a separate process?
PDT_DISC_LIKELI_IMPACT: We need modeling to complete design of the flushing lock; If we adopt a flushing lock procedure, we will need to mitigate water usage through the lock so we are not passing extra water over the dam.
PDT_DISC_RISK_MANAG_STRATEGY: Have regular communication with ERDC to set milestones and to ensure delivery of the physical model construction and delivery of the results.
ACTION_ITEMS: Finish R&D; receiving monthly/bi-weekly reports from ERDC

CONCERNS: Operational safety concerns of emptying filling system due to potentially increased hawser forces.
PDT_DISC_CONC: Decisions made to narrow the channel will magnify this concern; it also affects the prelockage/mooring; The lock operational procedures may need to be modified to maximize water exchange.
PDT_DISC_LIKELI_IMPACT: This would cause navigation delays if tows have to tie off further downstream. Impacts would be realized during operation, would not impact cost or schedule.
PDT_DISC_RISK_MANAG_STRATEGY: We're conducting physical model at ERDC to investigate forces. May need to conduct field testing after installation.
ACTION_ITEMS: Finish R&D. The team may need to do field testing during construction. The team may also need to adjust lock operating procedures.

CONCERNS: Validation of biological parameters  - does it work when floaters are present?
PDT_DISC_CONC: We could not conduct numeric modeling of barges in the chamber to measure the effectiveness of flush. How often will we be able to flush during certain times of the year? How do we buy down risk with physical modeling?
PDT_DISC_LIKELI_IMPACT: We're not able to clear floating ANS from the chamber at the efficacy level required.
PDT_DISC_RISK_MANAG_STRATEGY: Review hydrograph and compare to invasive carp spawning to capture this risk of passage during low flow periods. Conduct validation during physical modeling to identify a level of water exchange (effectiveness) for different head differential conditions.
ACTION_ITEMS: Finish R&D

CONCERNS: There are existing utilities/duct banks that run parallel to the lock walls, is there enough space to fit in culvert, avoidance strategy
PDT_DISC_CONC: New 6x6 culvert….proper space to fit within the existing lock structure?  Additional valve to force water through these valves, sequencing of valves, four valves needed to isolate the ports.
PDT_DISC_LIKELI_IMPACT: could prevent flushing from being feasible from the large upstream port which could result in less than desired efficiency.
PDT_DISC_RISK_MANAG_STRATEGY: Structures completed analysis and found there is space to construct what is needed
ACTION_ITEMS: Complete Design Charrettes and preliminary design

CONCERNS: Size & Number of Speaker Array
PDT_DISC_CONC: As the number of speakers increase, so will the construction and maintenance cost. Strive for modular design; redundancy
PDT_DISC_LIKELI_IMPACT: initial indication is the number of speakers can be reduced;
PDT_DISC_RISK_MANAG_STRATEGY: Continued R&D; re-evaluate BR acoustics cross walked with data collected at Lock 19 for improvements;

CONCERNS: Ambient noise

CONCERNS: Utilities, Footprint, Operations, Location (RDB vs LDB)
PDT_DISC_CONC: Right sizing it for incremental construction; operations resources; foundation system given site may be capped if HTRW is present; future expandability for future technologies; We may not be able to get HTRW information in time to meet 2024 construction schedule; Reason for the schedule risk is due to impacts to construction methods that may be required to construct on the peninsula.
PDT_DISC_LIKELI_IMPACT: The location could jeopardize overall project costs if we use LDB for construction
PDT_DISC_RISK_MANAG_STRATEGY: ROE to NRG to explore and sample ground; dialog with utility companies;  identify the closest source of power for delivery to site; Engineering Charrette (operations); get more permanent RE for future expansion if needed; creation of utility corridors/duct banks; investigating the possibility to construct on the LDB

CONCERNS: Efficacy of Acoustics
PDT_DISC_CONC: Limited systems are being tested. One system is patented so we do not have the ability to test. Do we have the right system? Are fish responsive to the systems being tested in the field? We need to maintain at appropriate levels that do not disrupt navigation and local residence. Is it sustainable?
PDT_DISC_LIKELI_IMPACT: If it's not affective, may need to abandon concept for another deterrent system; R&D will take several years to reach conclusions; durability; sediment
PDT_DISC_RISK_MANAG_STRATEGY: Continued R&D; MVR support of testing at L&D 19 test site
ACTION_ITEMS: Finish R&D, Design Charrettes, and preliminary design

CONCERNS: Ambient Noise
PDT_DISC_CONC: Ambient noise of the bridge could interfere with the acoustic deterrent
PDT_DISC_LIKELI_IMPACT: Bridge sounds overlapping with acoustic deterrent;
PDT_DISC_RISK_MANAG_STRATEGY: ERDC is aware of the risk; Conduct additional sound testing at Brandon Road.
ACTION_ITEMS: Finish R&D, Design Charrettes, and preliminary design

CONCERNS: Interaction with electrical barrier
PDT_DISC_CONC: We don't know what the effects the electric barrier or stray current will have on the speakers and their operation
PDT_DISC_LIKELI_IMPACT: May need a different speaker manufacturer, different sound systems may be needed. There are concerns with stray currents frying the acoustic speakers;
PDT_DISC_RISK_MANAG_STRATEGY: Test spare speakers in existing barrier to see impacts; collect field data on acoustics when they close the electric current; continued R&D;
ACTION_ITEMS: Finish R&D, Design Charrettes, and preliminary design

CONCERNS: Stray currents impacts on existing infrastructure, design of concepts, channel depths, etc.… Coast Guard provides final operating parameters after implementation, need stray current modeling as soon as possible, continue to be a risk because we can't catch up to other features dependent on this research, EC design to control stray currents, ensure public safety, ERDC research for levels of electrical current may not be concluded in time for design
PDT_DISC_CONC: Information from LRC available, but still a lot of unknown regarding conductivity and resistivity to limit stray current, proximity to existing infrastructure, safety considerations, on off uses, amount of time off vs on related to # of lockage's, power availability, anode corrosion, O&M costs, reliability data LRC is working on to develop efficacy levels, level of performance, system level of performance, proprietorship of technology,  potential use of vertical design in lieu of bottom up methodology, We need to make sure the research into what levels of electrical current are needed to deter fish of all sizes are taken into consideration. Existing design does not allow for fast and recurring on and off procedures.
PDT_DISC_LIKELI_IMPACT: Coast Guard regulations and safety protocol may be more than Romeoville. The Coast Guard has indicated that they are open to considering a different protocol at this location. Likelihood of schedule impact to the schedule due to the delay of R&D availability. O&M contributes to the overall costs.
PDT_DISC_RISK_MANAG_STRATEGY: Conducting stray current electrical modeling with CRREL.. Others to determine the potential range of stray currents, continued R&D, explore opportunities for solutions. Design is intended to have flexibility for voltage per inch. Design will have to have specific start up and shut down procdures to allow for rapid on and off operation.
ACTION_ITEMS: Finish R&D, Design Charrettes, and preliminary design

CONCERNS: What are we designing towards?  Operations of barriers, time of flushing, etc.…  Need to establish a baseline to measure against 15 min delay time was a study assumption. The time may not be accurate and the barriers may not be as effective as in the feasbility report.
PDT_DISC_CONC: 15 min flushing time was a study assumption, is that a correct assumption, use Johnna's slides of lockage sequencing, how much buy back can we realize in times savings, total transit time, need the baseline to measure, what does this mean for the next boat up if stacked up at Lockport or downstream, how does it relate to the LPMS data over a period of time, negligible, slight, large impact?  do queuing for barges to mitigate time, are we designing to time deck hand has to walk to front of boat?  What are specific design parameters we are looking to address?
PDT_DISC_LIKELI_IMPACT: Need baseline information to establish what impacts or differences the project will have
PDT_DISC_RISK_MANAG_STRATEGY: Collect AISP or time stamped interval tracking of vessels to establish a baseline so that we can then determine our impacts.
ACTION_ITEMS: Finish AIS

CONCERNS: Concern that bubbles could effect maneuverability of barges and it doesn't remove the fish, have not determined best layout pattern which would effect future work,  don't have design parameters, taking concept to implementation, never been done before, how does this interact with other technologies
PDT_DISC_CONC: research scheduled for FY22, provide best design we can now but may need to modify, What kind of flexibility can be designed in the feature to allow for adaptive management? Define design parimeters.
PDT_DISC_LIKELI_IMPACT: will impact schedule of design, air bubble curtain is in Risk Increment I
PDT_DISC_RISK_MANAG_STRATEGY: Continue R&D, Peoria lock demo Fall/Winter FY22, test barge maneuverability transiting air bubble curtain/field. Defer testing and go to full design implementation at Brandon Road to execute the testing.
ACTION_ITEMS: Finish R&D, Design Charrettes, and preliminary design
